#CHEVCF @kepa_46 Kepa acknowledges that many of the team will be playing their first Champions League game tomorrow but says they have waited a long time for this and spent all of last season trying to qualify. 

#CHEVCF @kepa_46 Kepa is first asked about how our style has changed this season. ‘We are a bit more direct, more end-to-end and there is more energy in our play because we go for the opposition goal as soon as possible.’

#CHEVCF Next up, it’s @Kepa_46...

#CHEVCF https://t.co/R3msz1GIvx Frank finishes by saying he expects Valencia to be tough to break down and a threat on the counter-attack.

That's all from the boss! Kepa will be up next in front of the media.

#CHEVCF Lampard explains he sees the Champions League as two parts, the first being the group stage and the second being the knockout round after Christmas.

'Our target is to qualify from a tough group. I have belief in the players. I'm confident but very aware of the dangers.'

#CHEVCF Frank talks about his goal against Liverpool in the Champions League, which came while he was grieving the loss of his mother, as a particularly special memory for him and one that bonded him even closer with the Chelsea fans and the club.

#CHEVCF Lampard says he will be proud to make his Champions League debut as Chelsea manager tomorrow. He cites multiple incredible nights in the competition, particularly at Stamford Bridge.

#CHEVCF Frank says he never had clear expectations for Tammy Abraham. 'I just believed in him and trusted him. I know a lot was made of the ban giving opportunities for young players but I felt now was his time.'

#CHEVCF On Kante, Hudson-Odoi and James, Lampard says they are all fit but not match-ready just yet. He adds Callum and Reece may play in another couple of Under-23s games before returning.

#CHEVCF Frank reports that Toni Rudiger is out of tomorrow's game. 'Toni is injured. He's bothered a small groin problem that he's been carrying for a few weeks and will have a scan later today.'

#CHESHU Frank says there is still possibility that Tiemoue Bakayoko or Kenedy could move on before the end of the European transfer window.

#CHESHU Frank praises Tammy's enthusiastic character and work ethic. Like Mason, he wants the forward to keep improving and push on because he will pick his team on merit.

#CHESHU Frank says he has been impressed by Sheffield United and is looking forward to going up against Chris Wilder and his team on Saturday. They caught the eye in the Championship last year and he enjoyed the tactical battle.

#CHESHU Frank says our Champions League draw is no walkover and we'll have to be fully on-guard to progress from the group. He's looking forward to the challenge.

#CHESHU Frank adds he is confident that praise and attention won't affect Mount following his great start to the season, but stresses it's important he keeps working hard.

#CHESHU Frank says he is delighted for Mason Mount to receive another England call. He adds that Tammy Abraham has had a good start and hopefully it's a matter of time for him.

#CHESHU Frank gives an update on team news: 'N'Golo Kante is not fit, a continuation of his ankle problem so he won't be travelling with the French squad either.' 

Pedro is also missing, and Toni Rudiger will play for the development squad tonight.

#SuperCup Azpi is asked about the impact of Tammy Abraham this season: 'I have known him for a long time from the Academy and he has improved a lot. He made a big impact at Villa and he deserves to be here. We need to keep encouraging him because the only way he will go is up.'

#SuperCup Pedro says the motivation to win trophies at Chelsea remains high and he's happy to be in another final. He has won the Super Cup three times before and is hoping to add another title to his collection tomorrow.

#SuperCup Azpi: 'This is a European trophy and there are not many opportunities to play this game. We lost in 2012 and 2013 so hopefully this year we can win it because we know it's an important trophy.'

#SuperCup Pedro: 'It will be a difficult game because Liverpool is a good team with strong players. We need to read the game well, stay compact and take our chances if we want to win.'

#SuperCup Azpi says we have to regroup as a team and work hard following the result at Old Trafford. He reiterates there were plenty of positives to take from the game.

#SuperCup Now it’s the turn of Cesar Azpilicueta and Pedro to speak to the media!
